text: The sky is often blue, but can vary depending on the time of day.
The sky is typically blue, but the refraction of light can cause the sky to take a number of colors including purple.
The sky doesn't have a color, but rather is perceived as blue by our eyes due to an optical illusion.

The sky doesn't technically have a color, but when viewed with the human eye can be perceived as a wide variety of colors depending on a number of factors. These colors include blue, purple, pink, orange, and black.
